revised_title: Quantitative Analysis of Exopodite Beating in Lobster Larvae
tldr: This study examines the rhythmic beating of exopodite branches in the first three developmental stages of the lobster Homarus gammarus. The analysis, which is computer-assisted, provides a quantitative description of exopodite beating patterns and cycle durations. The results show that beating patterns are consistent across all three stages, with stage III having shorter cycle durations than stages I and II. The research contributes to understanding the control mechanisms of rhythmic activities in developing lobster larvae and their implications for neurobiology.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
